description: Daria Tomenko, frustrated by inconsistent BCI outcomes and rising unrest, quietly pushes a clandestine firmware update to all health wearables, disabling BCI score displays and making BCI status undetectable citywide. Privileges tied to scores vanish overnight.

Residents wake to find BCI-based privileges and restrictions have disappeared. Confusion spreads as gates, transit terminals, schools, and clinics function without score checks. Social media buzzes with reports of spontaneous equal treatment.

Service workers and staff, realizing BCI enforcement tools no longer respond, adopt 'score-blind' policies. Teachers and transit operators publicly declare universal access, sparking grassroots momentum citywide.

Oksana Lintz cautiously signals approval for 'score-blind' service districts, framing the move as a pilot for system reform. Directorate officials respond with threats and order limited crackdowns, which are met with nonviolent resistance.

Districts holding to score-neutrality see swelling support and rallies. Standoffs between Directorate enforcers and citizens make international headlines, cementing score-blindness as the heart of a new civic movement.
